1122873428950667269.text: I feel like putting in the work *is* what shows your customers you care. (If you ever get a hand-written note from me, it's really hand-written by me... not a service.)pic.twitter.com/OkrpfFeRwA

1122348667589914626.text: Woah, I just discovered my Macbook Pro's "play" button on the touchbar now controls video players in Chrome!

1122617281467408385.text: You can do some clever things with Caddy using rewrites, but Caddy 2 does away with the need for rewrite hacks. (re: post by @herohamp_) https://hampton.pw/posts/AbUsing-Rewrites-And-Filters …

1123323573588742144.text: I do think not requiring GOPATH to organize active dev source code is nice, but kinda jarring that `go get` can no longer be used to get source code you intend to work on. Basically all dependencies will live in GOPATH/pkg/mod, and your source code can be anywhere.

1122320927105019904.text: FYI: In building Caddy 2, I'm watching as many questions about using Caddy (and other servers too) as possible. For example, this was in my inbox today. (This is already possible with Caddy, but we'll make sure it is easy in Caddy 2 too.)pic.twitter.com/lUbxqY5LF9

1122978524309086208.text: This joke is a little worn out. I know why I'm still single, no need to make jokes of it.https://twitter.com/hankrsmith/status/1122876904833466368 …

1122917536973053952.text: Caddy 2 will feature lightweight, dynamic, graceful (no dropped HTTP requests) reloads on all platforms. Including Windows.

1122974295129411584.text: Does anyone know why our pull request template on GitHub doesn't show up when creating new PRs? As per https://help.github.com/en/articles/creating-a-pull-request-template-for-your-repository … (step 3, last bullet point), we have https://github.com/mholt/caddy/blob/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE/pull_request_template.md …... but it doesn't appear.

1123323229219590145.text: In other words, `go get` will no longer populate GOPATH/src. You'll have to create the folder path manually and `git clone` the project, if you want to continue using GOPATH to organize your active Go code.

1123322873068736512.text: One of the #1 gotchas about moving to #golang modules was that it took me forever to realize that `go get` is only for dependencies now, not for getting working copies of projects for development. Beware that your development flow will have to change in Go 1.13!

1121551757971087360.text:
Go 1.13 is shaping up to be pretty fun:
- modules
- defer on stack (https://golang.org/cl/171758 )
- bunch of GC return-memory-to-OS improvements
- bunch of optimizations
- linker memory reductions, some speed
- record version & dep versions in binary
- sync.Pool love
- ...
#golangpic.twitter.com/VNxz44OO2V
